definition: There are three ways to be unfilial; having no sons is the worst. (citation from Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3])
pinyin: bu4 xiao4 you3 san1 , wu2 hou4 wei2 da4

sentences.english: Chen accuses his son of being not filial and asks for solatium .
sentences.chinese: 陳平狀告兒子不孝，並且索要贍養費。

sentences.english: Pan gets disobedient name, tonight namely abscond.
sentences.chinese: 拚得不孝名，今夜即潛逃。

sentences.english: Relatives have scolded him, saying he is irresponsible.
sentences.chinese: 親戚們數落他，罵他是不孝子。

sentences.english: His last act must be a deed of impiety .
sentences.chinese: 他最後的行爲就是這一種不孝。

sentences.english: A person who is unfilial to his parents and disrespectful to his elders cannot possibly attain blessings and protection.
sentences.chinese: 一個不孝父母，不敬長老的人，是不可能獲得褔佑的。

sentences.english: His friends were shocked by his ingratitude to his parents.
sentences.chinese: 不孝，令他的朋友們大爲喫驚。

sentences.english: When they grow up they will rebel and become unfilial children.
sentences.chinese: 長大後，自然動輒忤逆反抗，成爲一個不孝子。

sentences.english: Then you Gaima I unfilial descendants.
sentences.chinese: 這時，你該罵我不孝子孫了。

sentences.english: His son or daughter that he has reared with loving care may prove ungrateful.
sentences.chinese: 他用慈愛培養起來的兒女也可能變的不忠不孝。

sentences.english: Give obituary notice it when some unfilial shall kneel down in front of a longer period of time crying.
sentences.chinese: 故有些不孝子報喪時須在舅家門口下跪痛哭較長時間。

sentences.english: He was the black sheep of the family.
No one would criticize them ruthless or impious .
sentences.chinese: 因此，絕沒有人會批評他們不孝及無情。

sentences.english: His unworthy son was disentitled the right of inheritance.
sentences.chinese: 他的不孝之子被剝奪了遺產繼承權。

sentences.english: The unfilial son deserves it. What's the sentence?
sentences.chinese: 這種不孝子該告。法院怎麼判？

sentences.english: People consider unfilial behaviour out-of-bounds in Singapore.
sentences.chinese: 新加坡普遍認爲不孝是不可接受的。

definition: filial piety (Confucian virtue)/to be a good son or daughter
disgraceful (of behavior that is unfilial, rebellious or otherwise in grave breach of the norms of society)
filial/dutiful/devoted to one's parents (and grandparents etc)/to show filial piety towards (an older family member)/filial piety
of all virtues filial piety is most important (idiom)
to look after (elderly parents)/to serve/to support
to forget favors and violate justice (idiom); ingratitude to a friend/to kick a benefactor in the teeth
